title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VI, form 11 - Declaration of delinquency
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VI, form 11 - Declaration of delinquency

State Regulations

Sec. 410.30 C.P.L. FORM 11
(Declaration of

Delinquency)
1/87
________ COURT OF ________
COUNTY OF ________
________ x
PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, - against - Indictment/Docket

No. ________
________ DECLARATION OF
DELINQUENCY
Defendant. ________ x

On ________, 19________, defendant was
sentenced to a period of (probation) (conditional discharge) [FN1]. The Court has reasonable cause to believe that
defendant violated a condition of (his)(her) sentence by [specify conditions
allegedly violated and give reasonable description of the time, place and
manner in which the violations allegedly occurred]: ____________
____________
____________
Wherefore, it is hereby: ORDERED that defendant is declared delinquent, and it is further
ORDERED that, to enable the Court to make a
final determination with respect to defendant's alleged delinquency: (I) [FN3] ( ____________ and I jointly and
severally) undertake that defendant will appear in
() a warrant be issued, directing a peace
officer or appropriate police officer to take defendant into custody and bring
(him) (her) before the Court. [FN2]
E N T E R
Dated: ________, 19________
________, New York
______________
Judge (Justice)
[FN1] Strike words in parentheses, as
appropriate. [FN2] The option of issuing a warrant should
be exercised only where reasonable and appropriate. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. VI, form
11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
